definition: to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: The main point of theme is to transport someone into another work for escape.
sentences.chinese: 主題的重點是令人們暫時抽離了現實。

sentences.english: Some love, more wants to pull away but more more clearly.
sentences.chinese: 有些愛，越想抽離卻越更清晰。

sentences.english: Taking me away from the pain in my life and filling my heart with joy and wonder.
sentences.chinese: 把我從生活中的痛苦抽離，在我的心注滿歡樂和奇幻。

sentences.english: After about a minute or two, disengage from the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 在一兩分鐘之後，從交談中抽離。

sentences.english: When jeff pulled away, Maggie took it personally. This is a common reaction.
sentences.chinese: 瑪姬將傑夫的抽離當成私人問題，這是常見的反應。

sentences.english: As the bus pulls away, Rasha waves through a window.
sentences.chinese: 由於巴士抽離通過一個窗口，Rasha波。

sentences.english: Detach yourself from all that makes your mind restless.
sentences.chinese: 將注意力從令你頭腦不安的一切中抽離。

sentences.english: Some love the want to pull away, but the more clear.
sentences.chinese: 有些愛越想抽離，卻越更清晰。

sentences.english: Now see that dissociated positive image again.
sentences.chinese: 現在看見那個抽離的積極圖像。

sentences.english: Some loves, more want to pull out to Vietnam are actually clearer.
sentences.chinese: 有些愛，越想抽離卻越更清晰。

definition: to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
